results.title: Pass the word
results.creator_credit: Dave Gilbert and Epilepsy Foundation of America
results.brief_description: Epileptics face discrimination in the area of employment. Employees are reluctant to take on an epileptic, usually for reasons of job safety and insurance, this occurs especially in the manufacturing areas of employment. This film aims to improve the image of the epileptic, and to show that he is a valuable and productive member of the workforce.

results.title: Pas de deus
results.brief_description: Documentary on Phesoza Lally, an Indian from Bombay and Parsee from the Ancient Persian Dynasty. She studied in London and Russia, virtually unknown as a ballerina. This is her story. Interesting for students of ballet.

results.title: Partners
results.brief_description: A look at people who want to be their own bosses and who look for ways to create their own jobs. Shows students how, with imagination and some risk, a person can carve out a job that does not already exist.

results.title: Paracutin Volcano
results.creator_credit: Air Force First Motion Picture Unit
results.brief_description: Documentary film record of the 1946 research expedition to the volcano, Paricutin, in Mexico. Includes scenes of the volcano and the lava flow as well as scenes of the crater and the erupting volcano taken from a helicopter.
results.description: Documentary film record of the 1946 research expedition to the volcano, Paricutin, in Mexico. Includes scenes of the volcano and the lava flow as well as scenes of the crater and the erupting volcano taken from a helicopter.

results.title: Parabola
results.brief_description: Analyses the motion of projectiles. Leads to the presentation of a parabola as a smooth, symmetrical curve having a maximum (or minimum) point. From the series “Visions in mathematics”.

results.title: Pals & Sals (PC)
results.brief_description: This CD ROM is designed for VCE language programmes in both primary and secondary settings. It contains excerpts of the 1996 PALS and SALS satellite broadcasts (as seen on Sofnet), and the materials contained meets Victorian LOTE CSF and VCE standards. SYSTEM REQUIREMENTS: Multimedia PC that includes a 386SX or higher, at least 4MB of RAM, 2.5MB of available hard disk space, CD-ROM drive, audio board and VGA or VGA+. MS DOS and Microsoft Windows operating system version 3.1 or later.

results.title: Painting with flowers
results.brief_description: Constance Spry, famous over the world for her knowledge of floral arrangements, speaks about the beauty of flowers in the home and stresses that arrangements are not difficult and can be done with very simple vessels. We see a number of demonstrations for a variety of places in the home including wall decorations.

results.title: Over here: Irish music and dance in England
results.creator_credit: Carlo Gebler, Iain Bruce and Associates Film Productions
results.brief_description: Uses archive film to explain why so many Irish-born people live in Britain and records examples of the Irish tradition at work there. Reveals the rich tradition of music, song and dance which the Irish have brought with them to Britain.
